comments.content: Aligning AI strategy with the core values of the business is crucial, and ensuring adequate funding is the backbone to turning those ambitions into reality. Iâ€™m especially intrigued by how governance can serve as a catalyst for innovation. Andreas Welsch

author.name: Fred Lardaro
author.title: Ask me about SkyBell... self-monitoring Wi-Fi video doorbell security with one-touch 911... that helps make a smart home safer and more secure and more aware... and... smarter.

comments.content: Andreas Welsch... I don't feel like a failure with AI. Let me tell you why. I learn from people like you who curate content in ways in which I am comfortable and inspired... and your guests and I regularly follow others who create content in the language of strategy and critical thinking. And I play with AI with all the curiousness inside me. The Product Manager in me has been appreciating your sharing about funding projects and pricing. While people are solving business needs with new methods and AI systems... it is easy to forget about costs that mount from processes... while you might be looking the other way. Just sayin'. Keep up the good work.

comments.content: That preview of this weekâ€™s â€œWhatâ€™s the BUZZ?â€ episode on AI governance is spot on. It emphasizes the importance of strategic alignment, realistic funding, governance frameworks as catalysts for innovation, and continuous education for employees. By aligning AI strategy with business goals and values and securing proper funding and oversight, organizations can turn AI initiatives into sustainable growth engines. Maxim Ioffeâ€™s practical roadmap provides leaders with clear guidance to embed AI responsibly and accelerate adoption across their teams. Thanks Andreas Welsch
